review: This would be an easy five stars if 1). you didn't have to side load a settings app to use a bluetooth mouse, 2). didn't have to root or sideload to get Google Play and other apps (Showbox HD, Popcorn, etc.).If you plan to just use it as stock, the stick is a basic WiFi viewer that brings some degree of Smart TV function to older sets. The UI asserts itself so you can't use alternate launchers without aforementioned sideloading and tweaking.For the price, it's quite a deal, especially if you don't mind getting your hands dirty with it. If you want storage and more flexibility though, you'll need to spring for a regular Fire TV model so you can use USB peripherals like flash drives/readers and wired keyboards.
